Wolfson polarization index

Source: R/md_compute_polarization.R
md_compute_polarization.Rd

Compute the Wolfson polarization index for microdata.

md_compute_polarization(welfare, weight, gini, weighted_mean, weighted_median)

Arguments

welfare

numeric: A vector of income or consumption values.
weight

numeric: A vector of weights.
gini

numeric: Gini. Output of md_compute_gini().
weighted_mean

numeric: Mean.
weighted_median

numeric: Median. Output of md_compute_quantiles().

Value

numeric

References

Ravallion, M., S. Chen. 1996. "What Can New Survey Data Tell Us about Recent Changes in Distribution and Poverty?". Policy Research Working Paper 1694. World Bank, Washington, DC.

Examples

wbpip:::md_compute_polarization(
  welfare = 1:2000,
  weight = rep(1, 2000),
  gini = 0.4,
  weighted_mean = 950,
  weighted_median = 1000)

#> [1] 0.14
